member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch
member.summary: Provides a set of methods and properties that you can use to accurately measure elapsed time.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.GetTimestamp
member.summary: Gets the current number of ticks in the timer mechanism.
member.returns: A long integer representing the tick counter value of the underlying timer mechanism.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.Reset
member.summary: Stops time interval measurement and resets the elapsed time to zero.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.Restart
member.summary: Stops time interval measurement, resets the elapsed time to zero, and starts measuring elapsed time.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.Start
member.summary: Starts, or resumes, measuring elapsed time for an interval.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.StartNew
member.summary: Initializes a new Stopwatch instance, sets the elapsed time property to zero, and starts measuring elapsed time.
member.returns: A that has just begun measuring elapsed time.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.Stop
member.summary: Stops measuring elapsed time for an interval.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.Frequency
member.summary: Gets the frequency of the timer as the number of ticks per second.
member.value: A containing the number of ticks per second.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.IsHighResolution
member.summary: Indicates whether the timer is based on a high-resolution performance counter.
member.value: if the timer is based on a high-resolution performance counter, otherwise, .

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.Elapsed
member.summary: Gets the total elapsed time measured by the current instance.
member.value: A read-only representing the total elapsed time measured by the current instance.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets the total elapsed time measured by the current instance, in milliseconds.
member.value: A read-only long integer representing the total number of milliseconds measured by the current instance.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.ElapsedTicks
member.summary: Gets the total elapsed time measured by the current instance, in timer ticks.
member.value: A read-only long integer representing the total number of timer ticks measured by the current instance.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the timer is running.
member.value: if the instance is currently running and measuring elapsed time for an interval; otherwise, .

member.name: T:System.GlobalizationExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for uppercasing and lowercasing strings.

member.name: M:System.GlobalizationExtensions.ToUpper(System.String,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Returns a copy of this string converted to uppercase, using the casing rules of the specified culture.
member.param: An object that supplies culture-specific casing rules.
member.returns: The uppercase equivalent of the current string.

member.name: M:System.GlobalizationExtensions.ToLower(System.String,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Returns a copy of this string converted to lowercase, using the casing rules of the specified culture.
member.param: An object that supplies culture-specific casing rules.
member.returns: The lowercase equivalent of the current string.

member.name: T:System.ICloneable
member.summary: Supports cloning, which creates a new instance of a class with the same value as an existing instance.

member.name: M:System.ICloneable.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebUtility
member.summary: Provides methods for encoding and decoding HTML when processing Web requests.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string to an HTML-encoded string.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode(System.String,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Converts a string into an HTML-encoded string, and writes the output to a object.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlDecode(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string that has been HTML-encoded into a decoded string.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlDecode(System.String,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Converts a string that has been HTML-encoded into a decoded string, and writes the output to a object.

member.name: T:System.Strings
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:System.Strings.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:System.Strings.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:System.Strings.AdapterNotSupported
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This API is not supported on this platform..

member.name: P:System.Strings.AssemblyNotSupported
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to To use this API, the platform-specific assembly must be present in the probing path. If running on Silverlight, Phone or Metro, verify that platform-specific projects have a reference to their appropriate platform-specific assembly (Portable.Silverlight, Portable.Phone, and Portable.Metro respectively) so that it ends up in the package. Otherwise, if running on .NET Framework verify that Portable.Desktop is alongside Portable.* on disk..

member.name: T:System.Text.StringBuilderExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for instances.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringBuilderExtensions.Clear(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Removes all characters from the current StringBuilder instance.
